item.ptxt: Do not disconnect any part of the fuel system until you have discharged the fuel system pressure.
Even after discharging the fuel pressure, place a cloth or equivalent over fittings as you separate them to reduce the risk of fuel spray on yourself or in the engine compartment.

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal.

atten2.ptxt: Wait at least 90 seconds after disconnecting the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal to prevent airbag activation.

s2.ptxt: Remove the front driver side scuff plate.

s3.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, detach the 7 claws.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.

s3.ptxt: Using a clip remover, detach the 3 clips and remove the scuff plate.

s2.ptxt: Turn up the floor carpet and disconnect the joining connector, as shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: This connector has the lines of the fuel pump and rear speed sensor.

s2.ptxt: Connect the cable to the negative (-) battery terminal.
Start the engine. After the engine has stopped on its own, turn the ignition switch OFF.

atten4.ptxt: DTCs C0210/33 and C0215/34 (rear speed sensor circuit) and DTC P0171/25 (system too lean) may be set.

s2.ptxt: Crank the engine again, and then check that the engine does not start.
Loosen the fuel tank cap, and then discharge the pressure in the fuel tank completely.
Connect the fuel pump connector.
Install the front driver side scuff plate.
Clear the DTCs (see page ).

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT CABLE FROM NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL

atten2.ptxt: Wait at least 90 seconds after disconnecting the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal to prevent airbag activation.

s2.ptxt: Remove the radiator cap.
Loosen the cylinder block drain cock plug and radiator drain cock plug, and then drain the coolant.

atten4.ptxt: Collect the coolant in a container and dispose of it according to the regulations in your area.

s2.ptxt: Remove the oil filler cap.
Remove the oil drain plug and drain the oil into a container.

s-1.ptxt: DRAIN MANUAL TRANSMISSION OIL (for Manual Transmission)

s2.ptxt: Remove the drain plug and gasket to drain the oil.
Install a new gasket and the drain plug.

s-1.ptxt: DRAIN AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION FLUID (for Automatic Transmission)

s2.ptxt: Remove the drain plug and gasket, and drain the ATF.
Install a new gasket and the drain plug.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE INTAKE AIR CONNECTOR AND AIR CLEANER ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the vacuum hose.
Disconnect the No. 2 ventilation hose.
Disconnect the MAF meter connector and wire harness clamps.
Loosen the hose clamp and remove the 4 bolts, air cleaner and intake air connector assembly.
Use the hexagon-shaped part indicated by the arrow in the illustration to move the tensioner pulley downward and decrease the tension in the drive belt. Then remove the drive belt.

atten3.ptxt: When removing the drive belt, do not use the idle pulley's bolt.

atten4.ptxt: After removing the drive belt, move the tensioner upward to the maximum position.

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the reservoir hose from the radiator tank upper.
Loosen the 4 nuts holding the fluid coupling fan.
Remove the drive belt (see page ).
Remove the 2 bolts holding the fan shroud.
Remove the 4 nuts holding the fluid coupling fan, and then remove the shroud together with the coupling fan.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the radiator core.

s2.ptxt: Remove the fan pulley from the water pump.

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT OIL COOLER INLET HOSE (for Automatic Transmission)

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the oil cooler inlet hose from the radiator.

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT OIL COOLER OUTLET HOSE (for Automatic Transmission)

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the oil cooler outlet hose from the radiator.
Disconnect the 2 front airbag sensor connectors.
Using a clip remover, detach the 4 clamps from the radiator side as shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the clip remover tip before use.

s2.ptxt: Remove the 4 bolts and radiator.
Disconnect the vacuum hose from the intake manifold.
Disconnect the hose from the purge VSV.
Disconnect the No. 2 fuel hose from the pressure regulator.
Disconnect the No. 1 fuel hose from the pulsation damper.

s3.ptxt: Detach the lock claw by lifting up the cover, as shown in the illustration.
Check for foreign matter on the pipe and around the connector before disconnecting. Clean if necessary.
If the connector and the pipe are stuck together, pinch the connector, and push and pull the pipe to disconnect them.

atten3.ptxt: Do not use any tools in this procedure.

s3.ptxt: Check for foreign matter on the seal surface of the disconnected pipe. Clean if necessary.
To protect the disconnected pipe and connector from damage and contamination, cover it with a plastic bag.

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the ECM connectors from the cabin.
Remove the bolt and clamp, and disconnect the ground wire.
Remove the bolt and disconnect the ground wire from the frame.
Pull out the engine wire from the cabin.
Remove the engine room relay block cover (upper).
Remove the engine room relay block cover (side).

s3.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, detach the 4 claws and remove the relay block cover.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.

s2.ptxt: Remove the nut and disconnect the cable from the engine room junction block.
Disconnect the 2 engine room junction block connectors and disconnect the wire clamp.
Remove the bolt and disconnect the wire clamp from the front engine mounting bracket LH.
Remove the bolt and disconnect the sensor clamp.
Disconnect the oil pressure switch connector.
Remove the 2 bolts and disconnect the vane pump from the engine.
Support the vane pump securely.
Remove the bolt, dipstick guide and O-ring.

atten4.ptxt: Cover the dipstick guide hole to prevent foreign matter from entering it.

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the compressor connector.
Remove the 2 bolts and disconnect the suction hose from the engine.
Remove the 4 bolts and disconnect the compressor from the engine.
Support the cooler compressor securely.
Disconnect the washer nozzle hose.
Remove the 4 bolts and hood.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the vehicle.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE WINDSHIELD WIPER MOTOR AND LINK ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Remove the wiper motor and link assembly from the vehicle (see page ).
Remove the 9 bolts and cowl panel.
Remove the 2 bolts and 2 compression springs.
Disconnect the front pipe from the outlet pipe and remove the gasket.
Remove the front pipe from the pipe support.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE PROPELLER SHAFT WITH CENTER BEARING ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Place matchmarks on the propeller shaft flange and differential flange.
Remove the 4 nuts, 4 bolts and 4 washers, and disconnect the propeller shaft.
Remove the 2 bolts and 2 plates from the frame crossmember.
Pull out the propeller shaft.
Install SST to the extension housing to prevent oil leakage.
Disconnect the starter connector.
Disconnect the terminal cap.
Remove the nut and disconnect the starter wire.
Remove the 2 bolts and starter.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE CLUTCH RELEASE CYLINDER (for Manual Transmission)

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 bolts and clutch release cylinder.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE MANUAL TRANSMISSION UNIT (for Manual Transmission)

s2.ptxt: Using a transmission jack, support the transmission.
Remove the support stand from the rear side.
Remove the 4 bolts and transmission.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION ASSEMBLY (for Automatic Transmission)

s2.ptxt: Remove the automatic transmission (See page ).
Place matchmarks on the clutch cover and flywheel.
Loosen each set bolt one turn at a time until spring tension is released.
Remove the 6 set bolts and pull off the clutch cover.

atten3.ptxt: Do not drop the clutch disc.
Keep the lining part of the clutch disc, pressure plate and surface of the flywheel away from oil and foreign matter.

s2.ptxt: Fix the crankshaft in place with SST.
Remove the 10 bolts and flywheel.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE DRIVE PLATE AND RING GEAR SUB-ASSEMBLY (for Automatic Transmission)

s2.ptxt: Fix the crankshaft in place with SST.
Remove the 10 bolts, rear spacer, drive plate and front spacer.
Remove the bolt and rear end plate.
Install the 2 engine hangers as shown in the illustration.
Attach the engine sling device and chain block to the engine hangers.
Remove the 4 bolts and 4 nuts holding the engine mounting bracket and frame.
Lift the engine out of the vehicle slowly and carefully.

atten3.ptxt: Make sure to disconnect all the wires, hoses and cables from the engine. Keep the disconnected wires, hoses and cables off of the engine.

s2.ptxt: Place the engine assembly onto the stand.
Disconnect the 4 ignition coil connectors, and remove the 4 bolts and 4 ignition coils.
Using a 16 mm spark plug wrench, remove the 4 spark plugs.
Remove the bolt and ventilation pipe.
Detach the terminal cap.
Remove the nut, bolt and generator wire.
Disconnect the generator connector.
Remove the 2 bolts and generator.
Disconnect the oil pressure sensor connector.
Disconnect the noise filter connector.
Disconnect the camshaft position sensor connector.
Disconnect the 4 injector connectors.
Disconnect the crankshaft position sensor connector.
Disconnect the oil control valve connector.
Disconnect the throttle body connector.
Disconnect the engine coolant temperature sensor connector.
Disconnect the knock sensor connector.
Disconnect the wire harness from the clamps.
Remove the 2 bolts and wire harness from the engine.
Disconnect the throttle position sensor and control motor connector.
Disconnect the 2 water by-pass hoses.
Remove the 4 bolts and throttle body.
Remove the gasket.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to drop the injectors when removing the delivery pipe.

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the 4 clamps and wire harness from the delivery pipe.
Disconnect the vacuum hose.
Disconnect the 4 injector connectors.
Remove the 2 bolts and delivery pipe together with the 4 injectors.
Using 2 screwdrivers, pry out the 4 spacers from the cylinder head.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tips before use.

s2.ptxt: Pull out the 4 injectors from the delivery pipe.
Remove the insulator and O-ring from each injector.
Disconnect the crankshaft position sensor from the clamp.
Remove the 5 bolts, 2 nuts, intake manifold and gasket.
Remove the 5 bolts and heat insulator.
Remove the 6 nuts, exhaust manifold and gasket.
Loosen the bolt, and then remove the idle pulley assembly.

atten4.ptxt: The bolt in the illustration cannot be removed from the idle pulley assembly.

s2.ptxt: Remove the 5 bolts and No. 1 compressor mounting bracket.
Remove the 3 bolts and belt tensioner.
Remove the bolt, 2 nuts, water inlet and gasket.
Remove the thermostat and gasket.
Remove the bolt, pulley plate, idler pulley and spacer.
Using a 24 mm deep socket wrench, remove the oil pressure switch.
Remove the 2 nuts, bolt, No. 1 water by-pass pipe and gasket.
Remove the bolt and sensor.
Using a 19 mm deep socket wrench, remove the sensor.
Remove the bolt, sensor and O-ring.
Disconnect the sensor connector.
Disconnect the connector from the connector bracket.
Detach the harness clamp.
Remove the bolt and sensor.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE CAMSHAFT TIMING OIL CONTROL VALVE

s2.ptxt: Remove the bolt, oil control valve and O-ring.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT ENGINE MOUNTING BRACKET RH

s2.ptxt: Remove the 4 bolts and mounting bracket.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT ENGINE MOUNTING BRACKET LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the 4 bolts and mounting bracket.
